page.title: 15Wall Map
page.content: The famous{Wall Map}was put up in the Map Room of Southwick House in{May {l944.}It is made of plywood and shows the coastline from Calais to Brest. Originally it was part of a vast map showing the area from North Norway to Finisterre. The map was built by{Chad Valley Toys from the Midlands and fitted by two workmen who were incarcerated in the house until after D-Day, because they knew too much to be at large. After D-Day the, then Captain; Captain Norris decided the wall map should be preserved as a national relic and restoration has been completed. It was decided that the wall map should be{set to H-Hour {(actual time of the invasion) on D-Day and so it has remained ever since.
